intro: Chaenorhinum flexuosum subsp. flexuosum, commonly known as the slender horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and striking, bright orange or red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppy species.
